abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated highly
            satisfactory and project sustainability is highly likely.
            world Bank performance is adjudged as satisfactory while
            Borrower satisfaction is regarded as highly satisfactory.
            Lessons learned include the following: During project
            preparation to the appraisal stage, there is a need to
            combine supply (State) and demand-driven (market )
            interventions, gauge timely (appropriate) project
            implementation, include proper targeting criteria and
            performance indicators at the onset of project
            implementation, and use a flexible project design. During
            project implementation, ensure enabling conditions, pilot
            and evaluate before taking to scale, staff to build robust
            institutions, set up an appropriate legal and regulatory
            framework, build learning systems, ensure ownership at the
            outset of project implementation, arrange for appropriate
            dissemination and cross-fertilization, put in place a timely
            conceived exit strategy, and provide continuity in project
            management and supervision. At project completion, there is
            a need to continuously and consistently address pending
            issues in the education sector. For example, despite project
            efforts and investments, some inequities worsened throughout
            the life of the project, mainly due to exogenous factors
            benefiting private-paid secondary schools (outside the
            project's interventions) over the municipal and private
            subsidized ones. This points out that project objectives
            still need to be achieved after completion.
